screen_design_ref: Figure 16.1: Player Data Analytics Dashboard Layout
description: Verify that the Player Data Analytics page loads correctly when accessing /admin/player-analytics with authenticated admin user
scenario: Admin user navigates to the player analytics dashboard to view comprehensive player engagement and learning metrics
expected_results: Display the complete analytics dashboard with general usage stats, retention rates, engagement quality, level completion, and weekly trends
procedure:
1. Login with admin user credentials (is_admin=True)
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/admin/player-analytics
3. Verify page loads completely
4. Check page title displays 'Player Data Analytics - CyberQuest Admin'
5. Verify dashboard header with title and navigation buttons
6. Check all analytics sections are visible and properly styled
7. Verify responsive layout and gradient background

description: Verify player analytics page requires proper admin authentication and redirects non-admin users
scenario: Non-admin user or unauthenticated user attempts to access player analytics dashboard
expected_results: Redirect non-admin users to home page with access denied message
procedure:
1. Ensure user is logged out
2. Navigate to http://localhost:5000/admin/player-analytics
3. Verify redirect to login page
4. Login with regular user credentials (is_admin=False)
5. Navigate to analytics page
6. Verify 'Access denied. Admin privileges required.' message
7. Check redirect to home page
8. Test admin_required decorator functionality

description: Verify general usage statistics display correct player engagement metrics
scenario: Admin views overview statistics including DAU, WAU, MAU, and average session length
expected_results: Display four responsive stat cards with accurate dummy data from analytics system
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard with admin credentials
2. Verify Daily Active Users (DAU) card shows 847 users
3. Check Weekly Active Users (WAU) card displays 3,421 users
4. Verify Monthly Active Users (MAU) card shows 12,156 users
5. Check Average Session Length shows 30.8 minutes (1847 seconds)
6. Verify card icons display properly (bi-people, bi-calendar-week, etc.)
7. Test card responsive layout (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-4)
8. Check hover effects and animations on cards

description: Verify analytics dashboard header displays correctly with navigation buttons
scenario: Admin views analytics header with title and quick access to specialized analytics views
expected_results: Display header with analytics title and three navigation buttons plus back to admin dashboard
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard page
2. Verify 'Player Data Analytics' heading is displayed
3. Check subtitle 'Comprehensive insights into player engagement and learning outcomes'
4. Verify 'Back to Admin Dashboard' button links to admin.dashboard
5. Check 'Level Analytics' button links to data_analytics.player_analytics_levels
6. Verify 'Blue vs Red Analytics' button links to data_analytics.player_analytics_blue_vs_red
7. Test responsive header layout (flex-col sm:flex-row)
8. Verify button styling and hover effects with scale transitions

description: Verify retention rates section displays player retention metrics with progress bars
scenario: Admin views player retention analysis with day 1, day 7, and day 30 retention rates
expected_results: Display retention rates with animated progress bars and percentage values
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard page
2. Verify 'Retention Rates' section is displayed
3. Check Day 1 retention shows 78.5% with green progress bar
4. Verify Day 7 retention displays 45.2% with yellow progress bar
5. Check Day 30 retention shows 23.8% with red progress bar
6. Verify progress bar widths match percentage values
7. Test progress bar colors and styling
8. Check responsive layout and text contrast
9. Verify retention rates section animation delay (0.3s)

description: Verify engagement quality section displays NPS score, ratings, and engagement metrics
scenario: Admin views player engagement quality metrics including Net Promoter Score and average ratings
expected_results: Display engagement metrics with NPS score, star ratings, and total ratings count
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard page
2. Verify 'Engagement Quality' section is displayed
3. Check Net Promoter Score displays 42 with green color
4. Verify Average Rating shows 4.2 with star visualization
5. Check star icons display properly (filled/empty stars based on rating)
6. Verify Total Ratings count shows 2,847
7. Test star rating visual representation accuracy
8. Check responsive layout and alignment
9. Verify engagement section animation and styling

description: Verify level completion rates display with circular progress indicators
scenario: Admin views level completion rates for all 5 cybersecurity levels with visual progress circles
expected_results: Display five circular progress indicators showing completion rates for each level
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard page
2. Verify 'Level Completion Rates' section is displayed
3. Check Level 1 shows 89.2% completion with circular progress
4. Verify Level 2 displays 76.4% completion rate
5. Check Level 3 shows 58.7% completion rate
6. Verify Level 4 displays 34.1% completion rate
7. Check Level 5 shows 18.9% completion rate
8. Test circular SVG progress indicators accuracy
9. Verify responsive grid layout (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-5)
10. Check level title formatting and styling

description: Verify weekly trends chart displays properly with Chart.js integration
scenario: Admin views weekly trends chart showing DAU, sessions, and completions over time
expected_results: Display interactive line chart with three data series for weekly analytics trends
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard page
2. Verify 'Weekly Trends' section is displayed
3. Check Chart.js library loads successfully
4. Verify chart canvas element renders properly
5. Check three data series display: DAU (blue), Sessions (green), Completions (yellow)
6. Verify chart data points match weekly_trends dummy data
7. Test chart responsiveness and hover interactions
8. Check chart legend and axis labels
9. Verify chart animations and smooth transitions
10. Test chart in both light and dark modes

description: Verify quick stats grid displays performance, interaction, and security training metrics
scenario: Admin views summarized statistics for performance, interaction, and security training effectiveness
expected_results: Display three cards with key metrics: performance, interaction stats, and security training results
procedure:
1. Navigate to player analytics dashboard page
2. Verify 'Performance Metrics' card displays completion rate (67.3%), drop-off rate (15.7%), and churn rate (12.4%)
3. Check 'Interaction Stats' card shows avg actions/session (127.3), hint usage rate (34.7%), and retry rate (28.6%)
4. Verify 'Security Training' card displays phishing detection (76.8%), malware ID accuracy (71.5%), and asset protection (74.8%)
5. Test card hover effects and animations
6. Check responsive grid layout (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3)
7. Verify emoji icons and styling consistency
8. Test card animation delays (0.6s)

description: Verify analytics page integrates correctly with data_analytics.py backend logic
scenario: Analytics dashboard displays data from data_analytics.py route with proper dummy data generation
expected_results: All analytics data reflects the dummy data structure defined in the backend route
procedure:
1. Verify general_stats data structure matches dashboard display
2. Check gameplay_stats integration for level completion and interaction metrics
3. Test engagement_stats display for NPS score and ratings
4. Verify cybersec_stats integration for security-specific metrics
5. Check weekly_trends data integration with Chart.js
6. Test data serialization for JSON template rendering
7. Verify all statistics calculations are accurate
8. Check data type consistency between backend and frontend
9. Test error handling for missing or invalid data
10. Verify template variable substitution works correctly

description: Verify analytics dashboard components animate correctly on page load
scenario: Admin observes dashboard sections appearing with staggered animations
expected_results: Analytics components appear in sequence with proper fade-in animations
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache and navigate to analytics dashboard
2. Observe animation sequence on page load
3. Verify header animates first (animate-fade-in-up)
4. Check general usage stats animate with 0.1s delay
5. Verify retention/engagement section animates with 0.3s delay
6. Check level completion animates with 0.4s delay
7. Verify weekly trends chart animates with 0.5s delay
8. Check quick stats grid animates with 0.6s delay
9. Test animation performance and smoothness
10. Verify no animation conflicts or glitches

description: Verify Chart.js charts display correctly in both light and dark modes
scenario: Admin toggles dark mode and verifies chart text and elements adapt properly
expected_results: Chart.js elements adapt to theme changes with proper text colors and contrast
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard in light mode
2. Verify chart displays with appropriate light theme colors
3. Toggle to dark mode using theme switcher
4. Check chart text color changes appropriately
5. Verify chart grid lines adapt to dark theme
6. Test chart legend visibility in dark mode
7. Check axis labels and data point visibility
8. Verify chart background adapts to theme
9. Test chart interaction tooltips in both modes
10. Check accessibility and contrast ratios for charts

description: Verify analytics dashboard is responsive across different screen sizes
scenario: Admin accesses analytics dashboard on mobile, tablet, and desktop devices
expected_results: Dashboard adapts properly to different screen sizes while maintaining functionality
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard on desktop (1920x1080)
2. Verify max-width constraint (max-w-7xl) and grid layouts
3. Resize browser to tablet size (768px width)
4. Check stats grid changes (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-4)
5. Verify header layout adapts (flex-col sm:flex-row)
6. Resize to mobile size (375px width)
7. Check level completion grid adapts (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-5)
8. Test chart responsiveness and scaling
9. Verify quick stats grid responsiveness (grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-3)
10. Test landscape and portrait orientations

description: Verify analytics dashboard navigation links work correctly
scenario: Admin navigates between different analytics views and returns to admin dashboard
expected_results: All navigation links work correctly and maintain admin context
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Click 'Back to Admin Dashboard' button
3. Verify navigation to admin.dashboard
4. Return to analytics and click 'Level Analytics' button
5. Verify navigation to data_analytics.player_analytics_levels
6. Test 'Blue vs Red Analytics' button navigation
7. Use browser back button to test navigation history
8. Verify admin context preservation throughout navigation
9. Check proper URL routing for all analytics links
10. Test navigation from admin dashboard to analytics

description: Verify analytics dashboard loads efficiently with optimal performance
scenario: Admin accesses analytics dashboard and expects fast loading times with Chart.js
expected_results: Dashboard loads within acceptable time limits with all charts and functionality
procedure:
1. Clear browser cache
2. Open browser developer tools Performance tab
3. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
4. Record page load time and performance metrics
5. Verify total load time is under 4 seconds (including Chart.js)
6. Check First Contentful Paint (FCP) is under 2 seconds
7. Verify Chart.js loading doesn't block page rendering
8. Test page load on slower network connections
9. Check for render-blocking resources
10. Verify chart rendering performance
11. Test analytics with large datasets (if applicable)

description: Verify Chart.js charts function correctly with interactive features
scenario: Admin interacts with analytics charts to view detailed data
expected_results: Charts display interactive tooltips, legends, and proper data visualization
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Verify weekly trends chart loads completely
3. Hover over chart data points to see tooltips
4. Check tooltip displays correct values for DAU, sessions, completions
5. Test chart legend functionality (click to show/hide data series)
6. Verify chart zoom and pan features (if enabled)
7. Check chart responsiveness when window is resized
8. Test chart data accuracy against weekly_trends data
9. Verify chart animations and smooth transitions
10. Check chart accessibility features

description: Verify all displayed analytics data matches the dummy data structure from backend
scenario: Analytics dashboard reflects accurate dummy data for demonstration purposes
expected_results: All statistics and metrics match the values defined in data_analytics.py
procedure:
1. Compare displayed DAU (847) with general_stats.dau value
2. Verify WAU (3,421) matches general_stats.wau
3. Check MAU (12,156) corresponds to general_stats.mau
4. Verify session length conversion (30.8m from 1847 seconds)
5. Check retention rates match general_stats.retention_rates values
6. Verify NPS score (42) and average rating (4.2) display correctly
7. Check level completion rates match gameplay_stats.levels_completed
8. Verify security metrics match cybersec_stats values
9. Test weekly trends data accuracy in chart
10. Check all percentage calculations and conversions

description: Verify analytics dashboard displays correctly in dark mode
scenario: Admin toggles dark mode and uses analytics interface
expected_results: All elements display properly with dark theme colors and proper contrast
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Toggle dark mode using theme switcher
3. Verify background changes to dark theme (dark:bg-gray-900)
4. Check card backgrounds use dark theme (dark:bg-gray-800)
5. Verify text colors invert properly (dark:text-white)
6. Test progress bar visibility in dark mode
7. Check chart adaptation to dark theme
8. Verify icon colors and visibility
9. Test border colors adapt (dark:border-gray-700)
10. Check accessibility and contrast ratios in dark mode

description: Verify all icons and visual elements display correctly in analytics dashboard
scenario: Admin views dashboard with proper icon rendering and visual hierarchy
expected_results: All Bootstrap icons and visual elements render correctly with proper styling
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Verify all Bootstrap icons load correctly (bi-people, bi-calendar-week, etc.)
3. Check icon sizing and spacing in stat cards
4. Verify emoji icons in section headers (📊, 📈, 🎮, etc.)
5. Test icon colors match component themes
6. Check star rating icons in engagement section
7. Verify circular progress indicators render properly
8. Test icon display in light and dark modes
9. Check icon accessibility and screen reader compatibility
10. Verify responsive icon behavior

description: Verify analytics dashboard handles errors gracefully when data cannot be loaded
scenario: Dashboard encounters issues loading analytics data or Chart.js
expected_results: Graceful error handling with appropriate user feedback and fallbacks
procedure:
1. Simulate Chart.js loading failure
2. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
3. Verify graceful fallback for missing chart library
4. Test dashboard display with incomplete data
5. Check error handling for malformed analytics data
6. Verify fallback displays for missing chart elements
7. Test dashboard with network connectivity issues
8. Check error logging for debugging
9. Verify partial data load scenarios
10. Test system recovery when dependencies are restored

description: Verify data visualizations accurately represent the underlying metrics
scenario: Admin relies on visual representations to understand player analytics data
expected_results: All progress bars, charts, and visual indicators accurately reflect data values
procedure:
1. Verify retention rate progress bars match percentage values
2. Check circular progress indicators for level completion accuracy
3. Test Chart.js data point accuracy against source data
4. Verify star rating visual matches numeric rating (4.2)
5. Check color coding consistency across visualizations
6. Test percentage calculations for all metrics
7. Verify time format conversions (seconds to minutes)
8. Check data aggregation accuracy
9. Test visual scaling and proportions
10. Verify accessibility of data visualizations

description: Verify analytics dashboard works correctly across different browsers
scenario: Admin accesses analytics dashboard using various web browsers
expected_results: Dashboard functions properly in all major browsers with Chart.js compatibility
procedure:
1. Test analytics dashboard in Chrome (latest version)
2. Verify functionality in Firefox (latest version)
3. Check Safari compatibility (if available)
4. Test Edge browser compatibility
5. Verify Chart.js renders correctly across browsers
6. Check CSS Grid and Flexbox support
7. Test SVG circular progress indicators
8. Verify animations and transitions
9. Check responsive design across browsers
10. Test JavaScript Chart.js compatibility

description: Verify cybersecurity-specific analytics display correctly
scenario: Admin views specialized cybersecurity training effectiveness metrics
expected_results: Display accurate cybersecurity training metrics for each level and Blue vs Red mode
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Verify Level 1 fact check accuracy displays 82.4%
3. Check Level 2 phishing detection rate shows 76.8%
4. Verify Level 3 malware identification accuracy displays 71.5%
5. Check Level 4 vulnerability discovery rate and ethical methodology scores
6. Verify Level 5 evidence collection and timeline accuracy metrics
7. Check Blue vs Red metrics (asset protection rate 74.8%)
8. Test security training card displays in quick stats grid
9. Verify cybersecurity-specific terminology and metrics
10. Check educational effectiveness indicators

description: Verify analytics dashboard meets accessibility standards (WCAG)
scenario: Admin with disabilities accesses analytics dashboard using assistive technologies
expected_results: Dashboard is fully accessible with proper labels, ARIA attributes, and keyboard navigation
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Test keyboard navigation through all interactive elements
3. Verify tab order is logical
4. Check all charts have proper labels and descriptions
5. Test dashboard with screen reader software
6. Verify focus indicators are visible and clear
7. Check color contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards
8. Test progress bars and charts are accessible to screen readers
9. Verify section headings provide proper structure
10. Check ARIA landmarks and roles are properly used
11. Test Chart.js accessibility features

description: Verify analytics dashboard integrates correctly with base template and styling
scenario: Analytics dashboard extends base template and maintains consistent styling
expected_results: Dashboard integrates seamlessly with application theme and base template
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Verify dashboard extends base.html template properly
3. Check consistent navigation and header integration
4. Test theme consistency with rest of application
5. Verify CSS class consistency and naming
6. Check responsive breakpoints align with application standards
7. Test font consistency and typography
8. Verify color scheme matches application theme
9. Check template block organization and inheritance
10. Test JavaScript integration with base template

description: Verify analytics data could be exported or further analyzed
scenario: Admin may need to export analytics data for external analysis
expected_results: Analytics data structure supports potential export functionality
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Inspect browser developer tools for data availability
3. Check if analytics data is accessible in browser console
4. Verify JSON data structure in template rendering
5. Test data format compatibility for potential CSV export
6. Check Chart.js data export capabilities
7. Verify data timestamp and date formatting
8. Test data aggregation levels and granularity
9. Check potential for API endpoint creation
10. Verify data privacy and security considerations

description: Verify weekly trends chart displays time-based data correctly
scenario: Admin analyzes player engagement trends over weekly time periods
expected_results: Chart displays accurate time-based progression with proper date formatting
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Verify weekly trends chart loads with 7 data points
3. Check x-axis displays dates in correct format (MM/DD/YYYY)
4. Verify date range spans one week (2025-08-11 to 2025-08-17)
5. Check DAU trend line shows realistic fluctuation
6. Verify sessions data correlates with DAU trends
7. Check completions data shows reasonable patterns
8. Test chart tooltips display correct dates
9. Verify time series data progression logic
10. Check date formatting consistency across chart

description: Verify analytics focus on educational cybersecurity learning outcomes
scenario: Admin evaluates effectiveness of cybersecurity education through analytics
expected_results: Analytics clearly demonstrate educational impact and learning progression
procedure:
1. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
2. Verify level completion shows educational progression (89.2% to 18.9%)
3. Check retention rates indicate learning engagement
4. Verify cybersecurity-specific metrics demonstrate skill development
5. Check progression from basic (fact-checking) to advanced (forensics) skills
6. Test educational effectiveness indicators
7. Verify learning outcome measurements
8. Check skill development tracking potential
9. Test educational impact visualization
10. Verify alignment with cybersecurity education goals

description: Verify analytics dashboard doesn't negatively impact system performance
scenario: Analytics dashboard loads efficiently without affecting overall system performance
expected_results: Dashboard provides comprehensive analytics without performance degradation
procedure:
1. Monitor system resources before loading analytics dashboard
2. Navigate to analytics dashboard page
3. Check CPU usage during page load and Chart.js rendering
4. Verify memory usage remains within acceptable limits
5. Test network requests and data transfer efficiency
6. Check browser memory usage with Chart.js components
7. Verify no memory leaks from chart components
8. Test dashboard performance with multiple browser tabs
9. Check system responsiveness during analytics viewing
10. Verify analytics don't impact other admin functions

description: Verify analytics dashboard system meets security best practices
scenario: Security audit of analytics dashboard functionality and data handling
expected_results: Analytics dashboard follows security best practices and protects sensitive data
procedure:
1. Audit admin authentication requirements for analytics access
2. Verify analytics data doesn't expose individual user information
3. Check protection against analytics data enumeration
4. Test for information disclosure vulnerabilities
5. Verify proper error handling doesn't leak system information
6. Check analytics logging for security events
7. Test dashboard against common attack vectors
8. Verify secure Chart.js implementation
9. Check analytics data aggregation maintains privacy
10. Verify compliance with data protection regulations
11. Test analytics session security
12. Check HTTPS enforcement for analytics pages
13. Verify no sensitive analytics data in client-side storage
14. Test analytics access control and authorization
